nodes.documentation:
HashValue contract
     This Smart contract allows for the association of a hash with an Ethereum
 address.  One hash can be associate with a single address, one time only.
     Contract owner can update associations. 
     Emits a HashAdded event when an association is added / changed.
nodes.name: HashValue

nodes.documentation: @return whether or not the association was successful
nodes.name: addHash

nodes.documentation: @return the address associated with the registered hash
nodes.name: getHashOwner

nodes.documentation: @return true if the hash data specified has been registered
nodes.name: isRegistered

nodes.documentation: @return true if the address specified has registered a hash
nodes.name: isAssociated

nodes.documentation:
@notice onlyOwner function that bypasses existence checks to set hash
for an address.
nodes.name: setHash

nodes.documentation: @return whether or not the hash specified has been registered
nodes.name: _isHashAssociated

nodes.documentation: @return whether or not the address specified has registered a hash
nodes.name: _isAddressAssociated

nodes.documentation: @notice internal function to set mappings and emit event
nodes.name: _setHashValueForAddress

     Emits a HashAdded event when an association is added / changed.

addHash(uint256).return: whether or not the association was successful

getHashOwner(uint256).return: the address associated with the registered hash

isAssociated(address).return: true if the address specified has registered a hash

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

isRegistered(uint256).return: true if the hash data specified has been registered

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

setHash(address,uint256).notice: onlyOwner function that bypasses existence checks to set hash for an address.

userdoc.notice: HashValue contract     This Smart contract allows for the association of a hash with an Ethereum address.  One hash can be associate with a single address, one time only.     Contract owner can update associations.      Emits a HashAdded event when an association is added / changed.
